fields.label: Aim of the Rapid Response Mechanism
fields.description:
The rapid response mechanism allows policy makers to submit requests for specific information.

Information requests may: require new surveys on particular chemicals or in particular geographical regions; focus on specific vulnerable groups; require the development of new research activities; or involve new approaches to data analysis of existing data.

Please submit your request by filling in this form as detailed as possible. You have the opportunity of saving your answers and continuing later if needed.

fields.label: Step 1: Your contact details
fields.description:
We kindly ask you to identify yourself and your institution.

Should we have questions regarding your request, then we will contact you by email.

fields.label: If you are from a HBM4EU National Hub, please indentify your country
Please indicate whether you are a:
Please enter your request for information. Please describe the kinds of evidence that you need to answer the question.
Upload
fields.description: In the box below, we kindly ask you to upload any relevant documentation that will help us to better understand your request.

fields.label: Step 3: Chemical substance identification
fields.description: Please identify the substance, group of substances or mixture that your request concerns.

fields.label: Single substance
fields.description:
If your request concerns a single substance, please identify the substance below.

To ensure that we can correctly identify the substance, please provide the relevant CAS number and/or the EC number. For a description of these numbering systems, please place your cursor over the relevant ?

fields.label: CAS number
fields.customTooltip: CAS Number (Chemical Abstracts Service Registry Number): unique numerical identifier assigned to every chemical substance. CAS Numbers are up to 10 digits long using the format [xxxxxxx-yy-z]. See http://www.cas.org

fields.label: EC number
fields.customTooltip: EC number (European Community number): official unique numerical identifier for chemical substances on the market within the European Union (i.e. European INventory of Existing Commercial chemical Substances (EINECS), European LIst of Notified Chemical Substances (ELINCS) or No-Longer Polymers (NLP)). EC numbers are 7 digits long according to the pattern [xxx-xxx-x]. See https://echa.europa.eu/

fields.label: If you have any concerns regarding a substance group or mixture, please identify them below
Upload
fields.description: If you have identified a group of substances, please upload a list identifying the substances that you consider to be in the group.

fields.label: Please outline any questions you have regarding the hazardous properties of the substance, substance group or mixture.

Please describe the hazardous properties associated with the substance or substance group. In particular, please refer to classifications under Classification, Labelling and Packaging (CLP) Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008.
Upload
fields.description: Please upload any documentation regarding the hazardous properties of the single substance, substance group or mixture. This may include risk assessments, opinions of relevant bodies or scientific articles.

fields.label: Step 5: Current understanding of exposure
fields.description:
Please provide a brief overview of how human population is exposed to the substance, substance group or mixture.

Please also provide references, hyperlinks and/or upload materials, where available.

Where you do not consider a question relevant, please leave the field blank.

fields.label: Please outline any questions you have regarding exposure to the substance, substance group or mixture.
As far as you know, what is the geographical extent of the exposure? Is it  Europe-wide or limited to hot spots?
fields.customTooltip: Examples of geographical extent: Hotspots, regional, country/countries, EU wide...

fields.label: Is there a particular sub-group of the population likely to be affected?

To the best of your knowledge, please describe the media (air, diet, consumer products, occupational) through which human exposure takes place and identify the relevant exposure route (dermal, oral, inhalation, transplacental).
Please provide details of any relevant human biomonitoring studies that you are aware of. (Please include hyperlinks where available)
Upload
fields.description: Please upload any relevant documentation.

fields.label: Please identify any EU legislation addressing the substance, substance group or mixture.
Please identify any national legislation addressing the substance, substance group or mixture.
Have toxicity reference values been established for the substance, or for substances in the group?

If possible, please briefly describe the level of public concern regarding this substance, substance group or mixture. Please add relevant references and provide hyperlinks, if available. Alternatively you can upload files below.
If you have access to relevant information, please specify whether relevant biomarkers and/or analytical methods are available to monitoring the substance, substance group of mixture.

fields.description:
Thank you for your registration to the training school of HBM4EU in June 2019. Please complete the following form to submit your registration. You will receive a confirmation of your application after the registration deadline.
The training school will take place in Brno, Czech Republic, from 17th to 21st June 2019.

fields.label: Highest education (completed)
fields.placeholder: e.g. BSc, MSc, MD, MPH, PhD...

fields.description: Please answer the following four questions in this section if you are affiliated with a Linked Third Party (LTP) of HBM4EU.

fields.label: Please select the acronym of the LTP.

Please provide the name of your LTP Representative:
Please provide the email address of your LTP Representative:
Please provide the contact nr. of your LTP Representative:

fields.description:
(Please shortly describe below or upload as a file)

It is important to answer this question and provide your motivation description.

In case, the number of applicants outnumbers the available spaces in the training, the answer to this question and any uploaded information will be significant during the selection process.

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message:
Thank you for applying to the 3rd HBM4EU Training School! You will receive a confirmation email including a copy of your application to the e-mail address you have provided. Please remember to check your "Junk Email" as this email might end up in that mailbox.

You will be contacted via e-mail regarding acceptance for this training as soon as possible.

Kind Regards,

HBM4EU
